tools.description: Creates a new Stitch project. A project is a container for UI designs and frontend code.

title.description: Optional. The title of the project.

tools.name: create_project

DesignTheme.description: The theme of the design. Next ID: 20

backgroundDark.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The background color for dark mode (hex format, e.g., "#1a1a1a").

backgroundLight.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The background color for light mode (hex format, e.g., "#f8f8f8").

colorMode.description: Required. The mode of appearance of the design.

colorVariant.description: Optional. The variant of the dynamic color system.

customColor.description: Optional. A custom theme primary color, or a seed color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#ff0000").

description.description: Optional. A brief description of the theme aesthetic.

designMd.description: Optional. A markdown file that describes the design system.

font.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The font of the design. Planned to be deprecated in favor of `headline_font`, `body_font`, and `label_font`.

namedColors.description: Optional. The color scheme of the design. This is a map of color names to hex color codes. Example: {"primary": "#ff0000", "secondary": "#00ff00", "tertiary": "#0000ff"}

overrideNeutralColor.description: Optional. Override neutral color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#ffffff").

overridePrimaryColor.description: Optional. Override primary color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#ff0000").

overrideSecondaryColor.description: Optional. Override secondary color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#00ff00").

overrideTertiaryColor.description: Optional. Override tertiary color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#0000ff").

preset.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The preset color of the design.

roundness.description: Required. The roundness of the design.

saturation.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The saturation of the design between 1 and 4.

downloadUrl.description: Optional. The URL of the file for download. For image files, this would be FIFE base URLs.

fileContentBase64.description: Optional. Input only. The base64-encoded string of the file content.

mimeType.description: Optional. The mime type of the file. E.g. "image/png", "text/html".

name.description: Identifier. The resource name of the file. Format: projects/{project}/files/{file}

uploadBlobId.description: Optional. The BlobId from Scotty/contrib service file upload. This points to a temporary blobstore location of the file.

userFeedback.description: Output only. The latest feedback submitted for the file.

isRemixed.description: Whether this project was remixed or not. This allows the frontend to avoid polling for sessions since none will exist for a remixed project.

userRole.description: The Role of the user accessing the project.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Represents the project owner (whose user_id is part of the primary key for Spanner)
Represents users with permission to view the project and its assets

ScreenInstance.description: An instance of a screen on the project. Next ID: 15

groupId.description: Optional. Group identifier for Genie Agent output grouping. Screens with the same groupId are rendered and interact as a group.

groupName.description: Optional. Human-readable name for the group (e.g., "Warm Minimalism", "Ethereal Glow").

hidden.description: Optional. User driven action hiding screen from the canvas.

isFavourite.description: Optional. Whether this screen is marked as a favourite by the user.

sourceAsset.description: Optional. The resource name of the source asset. Format: assets/{asset}

sourceScreen.description: Optional. The resource name of the source screen. Format: projects/{project}/screens/{screen}

type.description: Optional. The type of screen instance.

x.description: Optional. The x position of the screen.

y.description: Optional. The y position of the screen.

UserFeedback.description: User feedback for a given interaction.

comment.description: Optional. Additional comment for the rating.

designFeedbackReason.description: Optional. The reason for the feedback for a design, if the rating is negative.
x-google-enum-descriptions: The design does not match the prompt.
The edit does not match the prompt.
The description does not match the design.
There is an issue with a component in the design.

rating.description: Optional. The user rating of the interaction.

outputSchema.description: A project is a single app.

backgroundTheme.description: Optional. The background theme of the project.

createTime.description: Output only. The time when the project was created.

designTheme.description: Output only. The theme used to generate the first design in the project.

deviceType.description: Output only. The device type of the project.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

name.description: Identifier. The resource name of the project. Format: projects/{project}

origin.description: Output only. The origin of the project.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified origin. By default, the project is created from Stitch.
The project is created from Stitch.
The project is imported from Galileo.

projectType.description: Optional. The type of the project. If not specified, the project is a text to UI project.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified project type. By default, the project is a text to UI project.
Pro version of text to UI project.
Deprecated. Pro version of text to UI project using image space for edits.

readTime.description: Output only. The time the project was last read. Populated only when listing recently viewed projects.

screenInstances.description: Output only. The screen instances on this project.

thumbnailScreenshot.description: Optional. The screenshot to be used as the thumbnail for the project. Same as normal design screenshots, this contains the FIFE serving_base_url which requires additional FIFE URL options to be set for sizing.

title.description: Optional. The title of the project.

updateTime.description: Output only. The time when the project was last updated.

visibility.description: Optional. The visibility setting of the project.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified visibility. By default, the project is private.
The project is visible to all users, and may be featured in the feed.
The project is visible to only the creator.

tools.description: Retrieves the details of a specific Stitch project using its project name.

name.description: Required. Identifier. The resource name of the project to retrieve. Format: `projects/{project}` Example: `projects/4044680601076201931`

tools.name: get_project

tools.description: Lists all Stitch projects accessible to the user. By default, it lists projects owned by the user.

filter.description: Optional. A filter to apply to the list of projects, following a subset of AIP-160. This service supports filtering on the `view` field. Supported filters: * `view=owned`: Lists only projects owned by the user. This is the default behavior if no filter is specified. * `view=shared`: Lists only projects shared with the user. Example: `view=owned`

tools.name: list_projects

tools.description:
Generates a new screen within a project from a text prompt.

**Instructions for Tool Call:**
*  This action can take a few minutes to complete. Please be patient. DO NOT RETRY.
*  If the tool call fails due to connection error, the generation process may still succeed. Please try to get the screen with `get_screen` method later.

**Output:**
*  **`output_components`**: If `output_components` contains text, return it to the user. If `output_components` contains suggestions (e.g. "Yes, make them all"), present these suggestions to the user. If the user accepts one of the suggestions, call `generate_screen_from_text` again with `prompt` set to the accepted suggestion.

deviceType.description: The type of device that captured the screenshot, e.g., mobile or desktop.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

modelId.description: Optional. The model to use for generation.

projectId.description: Required. The project ID to generate the screen for, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.

prompt.description: Required. The input text to generate the screen from.

tools.name: generate_screen_from_text

name.description: Identifier. The resource name of the asset. Format: assets/{asset}

version.description: Output only. The version of this asset. 0 indicates unversioned (legacy data). Incremented when the asset content changes.

BoundingBox.description: The bounding box of a component.

height.description: The height of the bounding box.

width.description: The width of the bounding box.

x.description: The x coordinate of the bounding box, relative to the image width.

y.description: The y coordinate of the bounding box, relative to the image height.

ComponentRegion.description: The region of a component region.

boundingBox.description: The bounding box of the component region.

description.description: The description of the component region.

type.description: The type of the component region.

xpath.description: The xpath of the component region.

Design.description: A generated design, which is a collection of multiple screens. Note: do not add new fields to this message or rely on it for any logic. For any Screen property, add it to Screen message instead. Design is a deprecated hierarchical container for screens and is only used for backward compatibility.

deviceType.description: Optional. The device type of the design.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

screens.description: Optional. The screens of the design.

theme.description: Optional. The theme used to generate the design.

title.description: Optional. The generated title of the design.

DesignSystem.description: Represents a collection of guidelines, design tokens, and reusable components that define the visual and functional characteristics of a product's design. This is used to guide the generation of consistent and branded designs.

designTokens.description: Optional. Serialized JSON object of the DTCG format design tokens.

displayName.description: Optional. The display name of the design system.

styleGuidelines.description: Optional. Freeform text description of the style guidelines.

theme.description: Optional. The theme of the design system.

PrototypeLink.description: A single interactive link within a prototype screen.

state.description: Optional. The state under which this link is active. Defaults to "default".

targetScreenId.description: Required. ID of the destination screen.

transition.description: Optional. The transition animation to use when navigating to the target screen.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified transition type, defaults to NONE.
New screen slides in from the right.
Current screen slides out to the right.
New screen slides up from the bottom.

xpath.description: Required. XPath to the interactive element.

PrototypeLinks.description: A collection of prototype links for a single screen.

links.description: Optional. The list of links for this screen.

PrototypeState.description: A named state that controls link behavior in a prototype.

name.description: Required. The name of the state (e.g., "default", "login-failed").

PrototypeV2Spec.description: The full specification for a V2 interactive prototype.

initScreenId.description: Required. ID of the initial screen.

links.description: Optional. Map of screenId to list of links.

screenIds.description: Optional. List of all screen IDs.

states.description: Optional. The list of states available in this prototype.

designSystem.description: Output only. The design system used to generate the screen.

deviceType.description: Optional. The device type of the screen.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

figmaExport.description: Optional. The Figma export of the screen.

generatedBy.description: Optional. The generated by field of the screen.

groupId.description: Optional. The group id of the screen. This is used to group screens that are related to each other (e.g. a group of variants of a design).

groupName.description: Optional. The name of the group (e.g., design package name) for display purposes.

height.description: Optional. The height of the screen.

htmlCode.description: Optional. The HTML code of the screen.

isCreatedByClient.description: Optional. If true, the screen was created by client calling CreateScreen API for user uploads or copy paste. If false, the screen was created by the agents.

name.description: Identifier. The resource name of the screen. Format: projects/{project}/screens/{screen}

prompt.description: Optional. The prompt used to generate the screen.

screenMetadata.description: Optional. The metadata of the screen.

x-google-enum-descriptions: If the screen type is unspecified, it is assumed to be a DESIGN.

screenshot.description: Optional. The screenshot of the screen.

theme.description: Optional. The theme used to generate the screen.

title.description: Optional. The title of the screen.

width.description: Optional. The width of the screen.

agentType.description: The agent type that generated the screen.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified agent type. The service will pick one.
The turbo agent, faster and with figma export.
This agent uses Gemini 3.0 Flash. The "PRO" name is a legacy from when it used Gemini 2.5 Pro.
The image agent, produces image screens.
The image pro agent, produces image screens.
The Hatter agent as a general assistant agent.
Agent powered by the Gemini 3.0 Thinking model. This became the new "Pro" agent after the Gemini 3 launch.

componentRegions.description: Optional. The component regions of the screen.

displayMode.description: Optional. Whether the frontend should display HTML or a screenshot.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified display mode. Defaults to SCREENSHOT.
The screen is displayed as a screenshot.
The screen is displayed as rendered HTML.
Displays the screen as a sticky note.

isRemixed.description: Optional. Whether this screen was created as a result of remixing or not.

prototypeSpec.description: Optional. The prototype spec of the screen.

statusMessage.description: Optional. A human readable status message for the screen, generated by the agent.

SessionOutputComponent.description: A partial output of the session.

design.description: The agent generates a design to be displayed to the user. Only applicable to TEXT_TO_UI and IMAGE_TO_UI projects.

suggestion.description: The agent generates a suggested response to be displayed to the user.

text.description: The agent generates a text response to be displayed to the user.

UserFeedback.description: User feedback for a given interaction.

comment.description: Optional. Additional comment for the rating.

designFeedbackReason.description: Optional. The reason for the feedback for a design, if the rating is negative.
x-google-enum-descriptions: The design does not match the prompt.
The edit does not match the prompt.
The description does not match the design.
There is an issue with a component in the design.

rating.description: Optional. The user rating of the interaction.

projectId.description: The project ID of the generated screen. This is the same as the input project ID.

sessionId.description: The session ID of the generated screen.

tools.description:
Edits existing screens within a project using a text prompt.

**Instructions for Tool Call:**
*  This action can take a few minutes to complete. Please be patient. DO NOT RETRY.
*  If the tool call fails due to connection error, the process may still succeed.

deviceType.description: Optional. The type of device that captured the screenshot, e.g., mobile or desktop.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

modelId.description: Optional. The model to use for generation.

projectId.description: Required. The project ID of screens to edit, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.

prompt.description: Required. The input text to generate the screen from.

selectedScreenIds.description: Required. The screen IDs of screens to edit, example: ['98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f61', '98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f62'], without the `screens/` prefix.

tools.name: edit_screens

name.description: Identifier. The resource name of the asset. Format: assets/{asset}

version.description: Output only. The version of this asset. 0 indicates unversioned (legacy data). Incremented when the asset content changes.

BoundingBox.description: The bounding box of a component.

height.description: The height of the bounding box.

width.description: The width of the bounding box.

x.description: The x coordinate of the bounding box, relative to the image width.

y.description: The y coordinate of the bounding box, relative to the image height.

ComponentRegion.description: The region of a component region.

boundingBox.description: The bounding box of the component region.

description.description: The description of the component region.

type.description: The type of the component region.

xpath.description: The xpath of the component region.

Design.description: A generated design, which is a collection of multiple screens. Note: do not add new fields to this message or rely on it for any logic. For any Screen property, add it to Screen message instead. Design is a deprecated hierarchical container for screens and is only used for backward compatibility.

deviceType.description: Optional. The device type of the design.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

screens.description: Optional. The screens of the design.

theme.description: Optional. The theme used to generate the design.

title.description: Optional. The generated title of the design.

DesignSystem.description: Represents a collection of guidelines, design tokens, and reusable components that define the visual and functional characteristics of a product's design. This is used to guide the generation of consistent and branded designs.

designTokens.description: Optional. Serialized JSON object of the DTCG format design tokens.

displayName.description: Optional. The display name of the design system.

styleGuidelines.description: Optional. Freeform text description of the style guidelines.

theme.description: Optional. The theme of the design system.

DesignTheme.description: The theme of the design. Next ID: 20

backgroundDark.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The background color for dark mode (hex format, e.g., "#1a1a1a").

backgroundLight.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The background color for light mode (hex format, e.g., "#f8f8f8").

colorMode.description: Required. The mode of appearance of the design.

colorVariant.description: Optional. The variant of the dynamic color system.

customColor.description: Optional. A custom theme primary color, or a seed color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#ff0000").

description.description: Optional. A brief description of the theme aesthetic.

designMd.description: Optional. A markdown file that describes the design system.

font.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The font of the design. Planned to be deprecated in favor of `headline_font`, `body_font`, and `label_font`.

namedColors.description: Optional. The color scheme of the design. This is a map of color names to hex color codes. Example: {"primary": "#ff0000", "secondary": "#00ff00", "tertiary": "#0000ff"}

overrideNeutralColor.description: Optional. Override neutral color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#ffffff").

overridePrimaryColor.description: Optional. Override primary color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#ff0000").

overrideSecondaryColor.description: Optional. Override secondary color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#00ff00").

overrideTertiaryColor.description: Optional. Override tertiary color for the dynamic color system (hex format, e.g., "#0000ff").

preset.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The preset color of the design.

roundness.description: Required. The roundness of the design.

saturation.description: Optional. DEPRECATED: The saturation of the design between 1 and 4.

downloadUrl.description: Optional. The URL of the file for download. For image files, this would be FIFE base URLs.

fileContentBase64.description: Optional. Input only. The base64-encoded string of the file content.

mimeType.description: Optional. The mime type of the file. E.g. "image/png", "text/html".

name.description: Identifier. The resource name of the file. Format: projects/{project}/files/{file}

uploadBlobId.description: Optional. The BlobId from Scotty/contrib service file upload. This points to a temporary blobstore location of the file.

userFeedback.description: Output only. The latest feedback submitted for the file.

PrototypeLink.description: A single interactive link within a prototype screen.

state.description: Optional. The state under which this link is active. Defaults to "default".

targetScreenId.description: Required. ID of the destination screen.

transition.description: Optional. The transition animation to use when navigating to the target screen.
x-google-enum-descriptions: Unspecified transition type, defaults to NONE.
New screen slides in from the right.
Current screen slides out to the right.
New screen slides up from the bottom.

xpath.description: Required. XPath to the interactive element.

PrototypeLinks.description: A collection of prototype links for a single screen.

links.description: Optional. The list of links for this screen.

PrototypeState.description: A named state that controls link behavior in a prototype.

name.description: Required. The name of the state (e.g., "default", "login-failed").

PrototypeV2Spec.description: The full specification for a V2 interactive prototype.

initScreenId.description: Required. ID of the initial screen.

links.description: Optional. Map of screenId to list of links.

screenIds.description: Optional. List of all screen IDs.

states.description: Optional. The list of states available in this prototype.

designSystem.description: Output only. The design system used to generate the screen.

deviceType.description: Optional. The device type of the screen.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.

A design that is not tied to a specific device.

figmaExport.description: Optional. The Figma export of the screen.

generatedBy.description: Optional. The generated by field of the screen.

groupId.description: Optional. The group id of the screen. This is used to group screens that are related to each other (e.g. a group of variants of a design).

groupName.description: Optional. The name of the group (e.g., design package name) for display purposes.

projectId.description: The project ID of the generated screen. This is the same as the input project ID.

tools.description: Generates variants of existing screens within a project using a text prompt.

VariantOptions.description: Configuration options for design variant generation. This message captures all parameters used to generate variants, allowing the configuration to be stored, replayed, or analyzed.

aspects.description: Optional. Specific aspects to focus on. If empty, all aspects may be varied.

x-google-enum-descriptions: Layout: Arrangement of elements on the screen.
Color scheme: Colors used on the screen.
Images: Images used on the screen.
Text font: Fonts used for text on the screen.
Text content: Text content on the screen.

creativeRange.description: Optional. Creative range for variations. Default: EXPLORE
x-google-enum-descriptions: Subtle refinements, closely adhering to original.
Radical explorations, fundamentally challenging the original.

variantCount.description: Optional. Number of variants to generate (1-5). Default: 3

deviceType.description: Optional. The type of device that captured the screenshot, e.g., mobile or desktop.
x-google-enum-descriptions: A design for a mobile device.
A design for a desktop device.
A design for a tablet device.
A design that is not tied to a specific device.

modelId.description: Optional. The model to use for generation.

projectId.description: Required. The project ID of screens to generate variants for, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.

prompt.description: Required. The input text used to generate the variants.

selectedScreenIds.description: Required. The screen ids of screen to generate variants for, example: ['98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f61', '98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f62'], without the `screens/` prefix.

variantOptions.description: Required. The variant options for generation, including the number of variants, creative range, and aspects to focus on.

tools.name: generate_variants
